name: Lidocaine
indications: lidocaine patch 5 % indicated relief pain associated post-herpetic neuralgia . applied intact skin .
contraindications: apply lidocaine patch 5 % intact skin cover painful area . apply prescribed number patches ( maximum 3 ) , 12 hours within 24 hour period . patches may cut smaller sizes scissors prior removal release liner . ( handling disposal ) clothing may worn area application . smaller areas treatment recommended debilitated patient , patient impaired elimination . irritation burning sensation occurs application , remove patch ( es ) reapply irritation subsides . lidocaine patch 5 % used concomitantly products containing local anesthetic agents , amount absorbed formulations must considered . lidocaine patch 5 % may stick gets wet . avoid contact water , bathing , swimming showering .
warningsAndPrecautions: lidocaine patch 5 % available following : carton 30 patches , packaged individual child-resistant envelopes ndc 51407-827-30 store 25 oc ( 77 ) ; excursions permitted 15 o-30 oc ( 59 o-86 ) . [ usp controlled room temperature ] . information , call endo 1-800-828-9393. manufactured : endo usa malvern , pa 19355 revised : april 2024 marketed : gsms , inc. camarillo , ca 93012 usa
adverseReactions: lidocaine patch 5 % contraindicated patients known history sensitivity local anesthetics amide type , component product .
indications_original:
LIDOCAINE PATCH 5% is indicated for relief of pain associated with post-herpetic neuralgia.  It should be applied only to
 
  intact skin.
contraindications_original:
Apply LIDOCAINE PATCH 5% to intact skin to cover the most painful area. Apply the prescribed number of patches (maximum of 3), only once for up to 12 hours within a 24 hour period.  Patches may be cut into smaller sizes with scissors prior to removal of the release liner. (See
 
  HANDLING AND DISPOSAL) Clothing may be worn over the area of application. Smaller areas of treatment are recommended in a debilitated patient, or a patient with impaired elimination.

 
                  If irritation or a burning sensation occurs during application, remove the patch(es) and do not reapply until the irritation subsides.
                  When LIDOCAINE PATCH 5% is used concomitantly with other products containing local anesthetic agents, the amount absorbed from all formulations must be considered.
                  LIDOCAINE PATCH 5% may not stick if it gets wet. Avoid contact with water, such as bathing, swimming or showering.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
LIDOCAINE PATCH 5% is available as the following:
                  Carton of 30 patches, packaged into individual child-resistant envelopes
  
NDC 51407-827-30
 
                  Store at 25 
  oC (77 
  oF); excursions permitted to 15 
  o-30 
  oC (59 
  o-86 
  oF).  [See USP Controlled Room Temperature].
 
                  For more information, call Endo at 1-800-828-9393.
                  Manufactured for:                            
  
                     
Endo USA 
  
                     
Malvern, PA 19355
 
                  Revised: April 2024
                  
                  Marketed by:
                  GSMS, Inc.
                  Camarillo, CA 93012 USA
adverseReactions_original: LIDOCAINE PATCH 5% is contraindicated in patients with a known history of sensitivity to local anesthetics of the amide type, or to any other component of the product.
